description: Relative class number h- of cyclotomic field Q(zeta_n).
comments: Note that if n == 2 (mod 4), Q(zeta_n) is the same field as Q(zeta_{n/2}).
references: L. C. Washington, Introduction to Cyclotomic Fields, Springer, p. 353.
links: R. J. Mathar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..162
example: Q(zeta_23) = 3 is the first time that h- is bigger than 1.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 16 2001
extensions: Washington gives an extensive table on pp. 353-360.
Missing term a(1) = 1 inserted by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 05 2009 at the suggestion of Tanya Khovanova
More terms from R. J. Mathar, Feb 06 2009
Changed a(59) from 41421 to 41241 (given correctly in 2nd edition of Washington), _Matthew Johnson_, Jul 20 2013
